intro: Feuilleea dubia, commonly known as the ghost fern, is a rare and enigmatic plant native to the misty highlands of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that resemble ghostly apparitions. The plant thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires a rich, well-draining soil substrate. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are located on the undersides of its leaves, typical of ferns. Due to its elusive nature and limited distribution, Feuilleea dubia remains a subject of botanical study and conservation interest.
